info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 19 at 1:37PM MDT until April 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions This Afternoon; Wind Shift With Associated Cold Front. More Critical Fire Weather Conditions Thursday... .Red Flag Warning has been issued as confidence has increased in multiple hours of critical fire weather conditions with southwest winds gusting up to 45 mph. A wind shift associated with a strong cold front moves through this evening. Blowing dust especially next to open fields is a possibility. The wind shift would create a dangerous situation if a fire were to be ongoing. Confidence has increased in critical fire weather conditions continuing Thursday with northwest winds gusting up 35 mph along with low relative humidity. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 254... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 254... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. * Winds...For Today Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph, becoming northwesterly at 25 to 35 mph gusting to 60 mph. For tomorrow northwest winds gusting up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...Around 12 percent. * Temperatures...In the lower 70s for today and in the mid 60s for Thursday. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Blowing dust is possible across western portions of Cheyenne County late this afternoon. A wind shift to the northwest associated with a cold front this evening would create a rapid shift in fire spread, if one were to be ongoing. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
